name: config-map
description: Applies environment properties to specified OpenShift ConfigMap.
author: Red Hat

inputs.name: openshiftService
inputs.label: OpenShift service connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select OpenShift service connection to use.

inputs.name: configurationType
inputs.label: Configuration type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Type of configuration for oc command. It can be a file path or an inline script.

inputs.name: configurationPath
inputs.label: File Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Filename, directory, or URL to the kubeconfig file that will be used with the commands.

inputs.name: version
inputs.label: Version of oc
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the oc version to use e.g. 'v3.10.0' (leave blank for latest). You can also specify a direct URL to a oc release bundle.

inputs.name: configMapName
inputs.label: Name of the ConfigMap
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the ConfigMap to which to apply the properties.

inputs.name: namespace
inputs.label: Namespace of ConfigMap
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the namespace of the ConfigName. If none is specified the current namespace is used.

inputs.name: properties
inputs.label: ConfigMap properties
inputs.helpMarkDown: To view the ConfigMap parameters in a grid, click on “…” next to the textbox.

inputs.name: uselocalOc
inputs.label: Use local oc executable
inputs.helpMarkDown: Check if oc is already installed in the machine and use that if available

inputs.name: proxy
inputs.label: Use proxy to download oc executable
inputs.helpMarkDown: make use of a proxy to download oc executable
